poem:
Title: "Conviction in Contingencies"

Watchdog winds sing
the anthem of the morning –
Their voices, promises in the wilderness,
echo the chant of past ignorance.
The road to culpability,
paved on the Colorado case's verdict,
Strange. The name of Freedom,
wears different faces in different times,
Yet, our truth remains –
Perfected by responsibility,
and ethically worn,
in the halls of supreme judgment.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘We were a voice in the wilderness’: the groups fighting to keep Trump off the ballot A US supreme court case that could remove Donald Trump from the 2024 presidential ballot is the culmination of several years of work by left-leaning watchdog groups to reinvigorate the 14th amendment and its power. A Colorado case that found Trump couldn’t run for re-election there was filed by Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington (Crew), though other". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
